citation.article-title: Rhodovulum lacipunicei sp. nov., an obligate sulfide-demanding phototrophic alphaproteobacterium isolated from a purple pond in India
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Rhodovulum lacipunicei sp. nov.
Rhodovulum lacipunicei (la.ci.pu.ni′ce.i. L. n. lacus -us a lake, a pond; L. adj. puniceus -a -um purple-coloured; N.L. gen. n. lacipunicei of/from a purple pond).
Cells are ovoid-rod-shaped, 0.7–1 μm wide and 1.0–3.0 μm long, non-motile and divide by binary fission.
Growth occurs under anaerobic conditions in the light (photo-organoheterotrophy/photolithoheterotrophy) or under aerobic conditions in the dark (chemo-organoheterotrophy/chemolithoheterotrophy).
Assimilatory sulfate reduction is not observed.
Internal photosynthetic membranes are of vesicular type.
The colour of phototrophic cultures is yellowish brown.
The in vivo absorption spectrum of intact cells in sucrose shows maxima at 377, 449, 479, 512, 590, 806 and 860 nm, indicating the presence of bacteriochlorophyll a and carotenoids.

The absorption spectrum of pigments extracted with acetone shows maxima at 430, 457 and 487 nm, indicating the presence of carotenoids of the spheroidene series (spheroidenone, spheroidene and hydroxyspheroidene).
Optimum growth occurs at 30 °C (range, 25–35 °C) and pH 7.0–8.5 (range, pH 6.5–9.0).
Does not require NaCl for growth, but good growth occurs at up to 5 % (w/v) NaCl.
Photo-organoheterotrophy with a few organic compounds is the preferred mode of growth.
Good growth is observed with propionate, butyrate, valerate, caproate, lactate, fumarate, malate, crotonate, pyruvate, 2-oxoglutarate, peptone, Casamino acids and yeast extract.

Aspartate, glutamate, glucose, fructose, acetate, succinate, glycolate, ascorbate and cysteine are also utilized, but not formate, ethanol, citrate, glycerol, mannitol, caprylate, benzoate, tartrate, gluconate, sucrose, methanol, propanol, butanol or sorbitol.
Photoautotrophic growth is not observed in the presence of sulfide, sulfite, thiosulfate, thioglycolate, elemental sulfur, ferrous iron or hydrogen as electron donor and NaHCO3 as carbon source.
Obligately requires sulfide (tolerates up to 7 mM) as sulfur source for growth.
Chemoautotrophic growth is not observed in the presence of thiosulfate as electron donor and NaHCO3 as carbon source.
Fermentative growth is not observed in the presence of glucose as carbon source.
Biotin and thiamine are required as growth factors.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 68.6 mol% (by HPLC).
The type strain, JA322T (=NBRC 104147T=KCTC 5700T), was isolated from a water sample collected from a saline pond with purple-coloured waters, located near Satpada in Orissa, India.
